Miscellaneous Highlights: The Sacramento Kings beat the Boston Celtics at their own game by making more threes than the Celtics and outsmarting them with a chess-like strategy.
The Kings outrebounded the Celtics by one man and scored 1.3 points per possession from their offensive rebounds.
The Celtics struggled to contain the Kings on pick-and-roll actions and had a lack of seriousness and communication on defense.
Jayson Tatum struggled against the Kings' defensive blitz, committing 8 turnovers and failing to find his teammates.
DeMar DeRozan woke up in the fourth quarter, scoring 12 points and delivering 4 assists to help the Kings win.
Others: The Celtics' recent struggles have fans moderately concerned.
The team has been inconsistent, and their loss to the Kings was an ugly one.
Coach Mazzulla emphasized that the loss was not due to a lack of effort, but rather a series of mistakes and poor execution.
